chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
y: nat
x: nat
b: nat

Goal:
2 <= b -> y <= x -> x * x + y * y = 1 + b * (x * y) -> {n : nat | x = alpha_nat b (S n) /\ y = alpha_nat b n}

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
alpha_nat = fun b_nat : nat => fix alpha_nat (n : nat) : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | 1 => 1 | S (S r as p) => b_nat * alpha_nat p - alpha_nat r end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments alpha_nat (_ _)%nat_scope
alpha_nat_Pell : forall b n : nat, 2 <= b -> alpha_nat b (S n) * alpha_nat b (S n) + alpha_nat b n * alpha_nat b n = 1 + b * (alpha_nat b (S n) * alpha_nat b n)
Pell = fun b_nat : nat => let b := Z.of_nat b_nat in fun x y : Z => (x * x - b * x * y + y * y)%Z = 1%Z : nat -> Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Pell _%nat_scope (_ _)%Z_scope
alpha_nat_Pell' : forall b n : nat, 2 <= b -> alpha_nat b n * alpha_nat b n + alpha_nat b (S n) * alpha_nat b (S n) = 1 + b * (alpha_nat b n * alpha_nat b (S n))
bezout_rel_prime_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q /\ a <= q /\ b <= p}}
utils_nat.pow2_dec_uniq : forall p a q b : nat, utils_nat.pow2 p * (2 * a + 1) = utils_nat.pow2 q * (2 * b + 1) -> p = q /\ a = b
Nat.div_unique : forall a b q r : nat, r < b -> a = b * q + r -> q = a / b
Nat.mod_unique : forall a b q r : nat, r < b -> a = b * q + r -> r = a mod b
Init.Nat.div = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => fst (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.div (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.modulo = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => y' - snd (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.modulo (_ _)%nat_scope
divides_trans : forall x y z : nat, x │ y -> y │ z -> x │ z
bezout_generalized_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> {a : nat & {b : nat & {g : nat & {l : nat & {u : nat & {v : nat | a * p + b * q = g + l /\ is_gcd p q g /\ is_lcm p q l /\ p = u * g /\ q = v * g /\ a <= v /\ b <= u}}}}}}
bezout_sc : forall p q a b m : nat, a * p + b * q = 1 + m -> p │ m \/ q │ m -> is_gcd p q 1
Z_coprime : forall u v : nat, (exists a b : Z, (a * Z.of_nat u + b * Z.of_nat v)%Z = 1%Z) -> is_gcd u v 1
measure_rect : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> nat) (P : X -> Type), (forall x : X, (forall y : X, m y < m x -> P y) -> P x) -> forall x : X, P x
BinIntDef.Z.add = fun x y : Z => match x with | 0%Z => y | Z.pos x' => match y with | 0%Z => x | Z.pos y' => Z.pos (x' + y') | Z.neg y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub x' y' end | Z.neg x' => match y with | 0%Z => x | Z.pos y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub y' x' | Z.neg y' => Z.neg (x' + y') end end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.add (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.lt = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y)%Z = Lt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
measure_rect2 : forall (X Y : Type) (m : X -> Y -> nat) (P : X -> Y -> Type), (forall (x : X) (y : Y), (forall (x' : X) (y' : Y), m x' y' < m x y -> P x' y') -> P x y) -> forall (x : X) (y : Y), P x y
Zp_opp_mult : forall (p : nat) (Hp : p <> 0) (x y : Z_Zp p), Zp_mult Hp (Zp_opp Hp x) y = Zp_opp Hp (Zp_mult Hp x y)
Z.le = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y)%Z <> Gt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.mul = fun x y : Z => match x with | 0%Z => 0%Z | Z.pos x' => match y with | 0%Z => 0%Z | Z.pos y' => Z.pos (x' * y') | Z.neg y' => Z.neg (x' * y') end | Z.neg x' => match y with | 0%Z => 0%Z | Z.pos y' => Z.neg (x' * y') | Z.neg y' => Z.pos (x' * y') end end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.mul (_ _)%Z_scope
M22mult_assoc : forall (R : Type) (Rzero Rone : R) (Rplus Rmult Rminus : R -> R -> R) (Ropp : R -> R), ring_theory Rzero Rone Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp eq -> forall x y u : M22 R, MU22 Rplus Rmult x (MU22 Rplus Rmult y u) = MU22 Rplus Rmult (MU22 Rplus Rmult x y) u
power_S : forall n x : nat, mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 (S n) x = x * mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 n x
Nat.b2n = fun b : bool => if b then 1 else 0 : bool -> nat Arguments Nat.b2n _%bool_scope
Zeq_bool = fun x y : Z => match (x ?= y)%Z with | Eq => true | _ => false end : Z -> Z -> bool Arguments Zeq_bool (_ _)%Z_scope
M22scal_MU22_r : forall (R : Type) (Rzero Rone : R) (Rplus Rmult Rminus : R -> R -> R) (Ropp : R -> R), ring_theory Rzero Rone Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp eq -> forall (k : R) (x y : M22 R), M22scal Rmult k (MU22 Rplus Rmult x y) = MU22 Rplus Rmult x (M22scal Rmult k y)
find_odd_alpha : forall b_nat : nat, 2 <= b_nat -> forall u : nat, exists n : nat, u <= alpha_nat b_nat (S n) /\ rem (alpha_nat b_nat (S n)) 2 = 1
BinNatDef.N.div_eucl = fun a b : N => match a with | 0%N => (0%N, 0%N) | N.pos na => match b with | 0%N => (0%N, a) | N.pos _ => BinNatDef.N.pos_div_eucl na b end end : N -> N -> N * N Arguments BinNatDef.N.div_eucl (_ _)%N_scope
alpha_nat_le : forall b_nat : nat, 2 <= b_nat -> forall n : nat, alpha_nat b_nat n <= b_nat * alpha_nat b_nat (S n)
M22_equal : forall (R : Type) (a b c d a' b' c' d' : R), a = a' -> b = b' -> c = c' -> d = d' -> (a, b, c, d) = (a', b', c', d')
Record ring_morphism (X : Type) (zX oX : X) (pX mX : X -> X -> X) (oppX : X -> X) (Y : Type) (zY oY : Y) (pY mY : Y -> Y -> Y) (oppY : Y -> Y) (phi : X -> Y) : Prop := mk_ring_morph { morph_z : phi zX = zY; morph_o : phi oX = oY; morph_plus : forall x y : X, phi (pX x y) = pY (phi x) (phi y); morph_mult : forall x y : X, phi (mX x y) = mY (phi x) (phi y); morph_opp : forall x : X, phi (oppX x) = oppY (phi x) } Arguments ring_morphism [X]%type_scope _ _ (_ _ _)%function_scope [Y]%type_scope _ _ (_ _ _ _)%function_scope Arguments mk_ring_morph [X]%type...
